intro: Phyllepidum squarrosum, commonly known as the roughleaf phyllepidum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its rough, hairy leaves that give it its common name. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is native to regions of southern Africa. It produces small, daisy-like flowers that are usually yellow or white in color. Phyllepidum squarrosum is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops.
